node.title: 'We’re all not the same': Former Don Dale detainees speak in support of $35 million class action
node.alt: Inmates at Don Dale play basketball on a court enclosed by bars and fencing.
node.description: Lawyers are seeking more time to sign up hundreds of former youth justice detainees to the multi-million-dollar compensation claim, while a federal court takes time to consider if the settlement sum is fair and reasonable.
node.content:
["More than a dozen former youth justice detainees have told the federal court about their experiences in the Don Dale and Alice Springs detention centres, as lawyers seek more time\u00a0to sign\u00a0people up to a $35 million dollar class action over mistreatment in the Territory\u2019s youth justice system.", "The $35 million deal between former youth justice detainees and the Northern Territory government\u00a0is still awaiting the tick of approval from federal court Justice Debra Mortimer, who needs to decide if the settlement sum is \"fair and reasonable\".", "Speaking to the court from the Darwin\u00a0Correctional Centre, former Don Dale detainee Lee\u00a0Martin spoke\u00a0in support of the proposed settlement.", "\u201cEverything that's happened to us, we\u2019re all not the same, we\u2019ve all come out of it differently,\u201d he said.", "\u201cExactly what they have done, they have\u00a0changed a lot of people\u2019s lives. They\u2019ve stopped a lot of people being themselves.\u201d", "
'I believed my funeral was going to be the next one'
", "The court heard directly from six former youth detainees about their experiences in the system\u00a0while a lawyer\u00a0read\u00a0anonymised\u00a0letters from a dozen more class members who spent time in\u00a0the Territory's youth justice system.\u00a0", "Many spoke of excessive force and isolation, frequent and unnecessary strip searches and lasting trauma.", "", "
The court heard\u00a0220 of the class members who spent time in the NT's youth justice system are currently\u00a0incarcerated.(ABC News: Jane Bardon)
", "Some said they wanted to make sure what happened to them would never be allowed to happen again and said they would use the\u00a0compensation to help heal themselves and the next generation.", "Speaking from the Alice Springs Correctional facility, former Don Dale detainee Brendan Green-Robinson said he was\u00a0scared and confused during his time in youth detention.", "\"I believed my funeral was going to be the next one,\"\u00a0he said.", "
Hundreds of class members yet to register
", "The proposed multi-million-dollar settlement between former youth justice detainees and the Northern Territory was reached with denial of liability from the NT government in May 2021.", "The $35 million figure\u00a0became public in July after a failed bid by the government to get the figure suppressed.\u00a0", "It is understood to be\u00a0the largest class action settlement figure in Territory government history.", "Young people who spent time in NT youth detention centres between 2006 and 2017 are potentially eligible for compensation.\u00a0", "That amounts to nearly 1,200 people, though the federal court heard only 464 of them had registered so far.\u00a0\u00a0", "", "
The court heard the class action\u00a0could have gone to a two-month trial with more than\u00a080 witnesses, if it did not settle out of court.(AAP: Neda Vanovac)
", "The court also heard 220 class members are currently\u00a0incarcerated.", "The lawyers leading the class action, Maurice Blackburn, have made an application for an extension of time to connect with outstanding group members.\u00a0", "The initial deadline\u00a0to register was November 16 but lawyers have sought\u00a0an extension until\u00a0mid-next year.\u00a0", "The NT government did not oppose the extension.\u00a0", "
$35 million deal avoids the trauma of a trial, court hears
", "The court also heard the proposed settlement deal had avoided an expensive eight-week trial which would have called more than 80 witnesses.", "Lawyer for the applicants, Paul Batley said the decision to settle\u00a0helped to avoid re-traumatising class members and witnesses.\u00a0", "The parties appeared to agree on a settlement distribution method calculated based on a daily rate for\u00a0the amount of time spent in custody, with higher rates calculated for days spent in isolation or higher security.", "This would initially work on the assumption that all of the\u00a01,200 class members\u00a0will eventually register, but if they do not, the remainder of the money will be paid back to group members proportionally.", "Justice Mortimer reserved her decision on the time extension for class members to\u00a0register\u00a0but indicated she could put a\u00a0pause on the November 16 expiry date so registrations could continue until\u00a0the matter returns to court.\u00a0", "She told the court she would come back with a final verdict on whether or not the entire deal was approved \"as soon as I'm able to\".", "She also thanked the group members who shared their stories with the court.\u00a0", "\"It takes a lot of courage to do that,\" she said.\u00a0", "\"I've listened very carefully to what you've had to say.\""]
